questions.text: Which of the following cities is in Australia?
questions.explanation:
Darwin.

	Darwin is the capital city of the Northern Territory in Australia; Doha, also known as ad-Dawhah, is in eastern Qatar, and is the capital and is where more than half the population lives; Dili is the capital of East Timor; and, Dodoma is the official capital city of Tanzania.

questions.text: Where in the world is the city of Dajabón?
questions.explanation:
Dominican Republic.

	Situated in the north west of the Dominican Republic, Dajabón is near the border of Haiti.

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in the Netherlands?
questions.explanation:
Delft.

	Delft is in the west of the Netherlands, on the Schie River, between Rotterdam and The Hague; Dortmund is a city in the central west of Germany on the Ems River; Dunfermline is a city on the north shore of the Firth of Forth in Scotland; and, Debrecen is one of the largest cities in Hungary.

questions.text: Which of the following was a mainland city in ancient Greece?
questions.explanation:
Delphi.

	Delphi was built as a shrine to the God Apollo; Delos is a Greek island in the Cyclades group; Delphos is the name of three US cities, one in each of Iowa, Ohio and Kansas; and, Demerara is a region in Guyana with a type of sugar named after it!

questions.text: In 2001, what was the most populous of the following Asian cities?
questions.explanation:
Delhi.

	With a city population (2001) of over nine million, Delhi is on the Yamuna River, a tributary of the Ganges; Dublin, capital of the Republic of Ireland, had a population of around one million (and could not be considered an Asian city, by any stretch); Denpasar, the capital of Bali, had a population of over three million; and, Dhading, a city in Nepal, had a population over three hundred thousand.

questions.text: In which country is the city of Dikhil?
questions.explanation:
Djibouti.

	Dikhil, in the Republic of Djibouti, is situated closest to the border with Ethiopia.

questions.text: Which of the following is a Canadian city situated on the Yukon River?
questions.explanation:
Dawson.

	Dawson lies at the mouth of the Klondike River and was declared a city in 1902; Dacono is a city in Colorado, USA; Denmark is a city in South Carolina, USA; and, Dallas is a city not only in Texas, but there's a city named Dallas in Georgia, Oregon, and North Carolina, USA, named for Vice-President George M Dallas!

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a capital city?
questions.explanation:
Dalmatia.

	Dalmatia is an historic region in Croatia; Dili is the capital of East Timor; Dhaka is the capital of Bangladesh; and, Djibouti is the capital of Djibouti!

questions.text: Which of the following cities is in the United Arab Emirates?
questions.explanation:
Dubai.

	Dubai is located in the north east of the United Arab Emirates; Danzig is in northern Poland, where it is called Gdansk (the name Danzig is German); and, Doula city is on the Wouri River in the west of Cameroon. Doha is the capital of Qatar

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in England?
questions.explanation:
Derby.

	The city of Derby, on the Derwent River, is located in central England and was given city status in 1977; Dorchester is England, but is a town not a city; Dublin is the capital of the Republic of Ireland; and, Dundee is in eastern Scotland on the Firth of Tay.

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in Egypt?
questions.explanation:
Damanhur.

	Damanhur is the capital of the Beheira Governorate which is situated in northern Egypt, on the Nile River delta; Dieppe is a city in northern France, on the English Channel; Daman is a town in the north west of India; and, Debrecen is one of the largest cities in Hungary. There is also a village in Italy called Damanhur.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a city in Egypt?
questions.explanation:
Damascus.

	Located in the south west of Syria on the banks of the Barada River,  Damascus has more than two hundred mosques!  Damask, a type of fabric, gets its name from the silks originally woven in Damascus; Domyat or alternatively, Damietta, is a city in northern Egypt which is located on Lake Manzala near the Mediterranean Sea; and, Damanhur is the capital of the Beheira Governorate which is situated in northern Egypt, on the Nile River delta.

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in Bulgaria?
questions.explanation:
Dobrich.

	Dobrich was named in 1882 and is situated in the Dobrudzha plateau inland from Varna (which is on the Black Sea) in the Republic of Bulgaria; Douala is Cameroon's largest city; Dalian is a city on the Liaodong Peninsula in the Bay of Korea, China; and, Dubrovnik is on the south coast of Croatia, on the Adriatic Sea.

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in Mongolia?
questions.explanation:
Darhan.

	Darhan is near the Russian border in Mongolia; Dunedin is a city in New Zealand; Daru is in Papua New Guinea; and, Diyarbakir is the capital of the Diyarbakir Province in south east Turkey.

questions.text: What is the name of the capital city of Tanzania?
questions.explanation:
Dodoma.

	Dodoma became the official capital of Tanzania in 1996.
